summary: Federal agencies administer employment and training programs to help job seekers find and get work. While we identified 47 such programs in 2011 , there are 43 now. Spending for these programs has decreased as well. Multiple programs provide similar services, often to similar groups of people. While agencies have tried to manage this overlap by trying to coordinate their programs, they generally don't know...
title: Employment and Training Programs: Department of Labor Should Assess Efforts to Coordinate Services Across Programs
